text: Llaushë is a village in the Mitrovicë district of Kosovo. Its name refers to the former presence of Aromanians in the region, having originally been "Vllahushë", vllah being the Albanian rendering of the Aromanian exonym "Vlach". Artan Xhaferaj (2018). "Slavonic and Greek Traces in the Toponymy of the Region of Vlora, Southern Albania". European Journal of Language and Literature Studies volume 4 number 1. Page 86 ==Notes== ==References== Category:Villages in Skenderaj
title: Llaushë
